channel.title: All out linux
channel.description: Until now I have duel booted ubuntu with windows7 but as more and more errors piled up with windows 7 I have decided to go with Ubuntu as my main operating system (windows xp will run in a virtual computer when I need it). So this topic is really to discuss Ubuntu more in depth with the community, we all talk about how linux is awesome, but what are the pro's and cons? What could make someone want to make the switch? (:

item.title: All out linux
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:20, topic:421539”]I was talking about something else. He says “Like people who use proprietary software instead of open-source software.”, meaning that those who use open source software are the real deal. I say that out of those people, 1 in 10000 will actually look at he source an modify it.[/quote]So what?

Read full topic

item.title: All out linux
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:18, topic:421539”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=524195.msg3815932#msg3815932 date=1321327562]

[quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=524195.msg3814453#msg3814453 date=1321207476]

[quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=524195.msg3814446#msg3814446 date=1321207014]

Until now I have duel booted ubuntu with windows7 but as more and more errors piled up with windows 7 I have decided to go with Ubuntu as my main operating system (windows xp will run in a virtual computer when I need it). So this topic is really to discuss Ubuntu more in depth with the community, we all talk about how linux is awesome, but what are the pro’s and cons? What could make someone want to make the switch? (:
[/quote]Those errors are thanks to you, not Windows 7.
I’ve ran 7 for more than 2 years now, different builds, and there wasn’t an error I couldn’t fix.

They were the operating system itself, windows dvd burner couldn’t even handle a sound codec. It crashed each time it even tried.
[/quote]Who uses Windows DVD Burner? Ever heard of 3rd party software? My current Windows didn’t have some video and sound codecs I used regularly so I went and DOWNLOADED them.

Windows is clean when you install it, you add what you need to the OS by downloading software that is written for Windows. Ubuntu has a bunch of pre-installed shit going on, so you don’t need to do shit.

Now that I said that, I realized that not everyone likes customization and that some people like to stay with the defaults. In that case go ahead and download some Linux distro.

You’re right, some people don’t like customization. Like people who use proprietary software instead of open-source software. Like… Windows users to be more specific.
[/quote]Do you actually know how many of those so called open source guys edit the source? Or even look at it?[/quote]The source to what? Usually programs have teams that work on projects or specific areas.

Read full topic

[/quote]Who uses Windows DVD Burner? Ever heard of 3rd party software? My current Windows didn’t have some video and sound codecs I used regularly so I went and DOWNLOADED them.

Windows is clean when you install it, you add what you need to the OS by downloading software that is written for Windows. Ubuntu has a bunch of pre-installed shit going on, so you don’t need to do shit.

Now that I said that, I realized that not everyone likes customization and that some people like to stay with the defaults. In that case go ahead and download some Linux distro.

You’re right, some people don’t like customization. Like people who use proprietary software instead of open-source software. Like… Windows users to be more specific.[/quote]Do you actually know how many of those so called open source guys edit the source? Or even look at it?

item.title: All out linux
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

If you use a proper operating system java is simply as easy as Downloading the tarball to build the package, extracting it, running makepkg followed by pacman -U the-package-you-just-created.

or if you’re hardcore and stupid the command:
pacman -S jre7-openjdk

will do.

Read full topic

item.title: All out linux
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Did you guys know you can uninstall applications you don’t need? Ubuntu, for instance, comes pre-installed with a variety of applications to make the user feel comfortable but if you don’t need some of them, or prefer others, then you can just uninstall them. Windows doesn’t even allow you to easily uninstall some applications.

Now that I said that, I realized that not everyone likes customization and that some people like to stay with the defaults. In that case go ahead and download some Linux distro.
http://www.archlinux.org/
Arch Linux is an independently developed, i686/x86-64 general purpose GNU/Linux distribution versatile enough to suit any role. Development focuses on simplicity, minimalism, and code elegance. Arch is installed as a minimal base system, configured by the user upon which their own ideal environment is assembled by installing only what is required or desired for their unique purposes. GUI configuration utilities are not officially provided, and most system configuration is performed from the shell by editing simple text files. Based on a rolling-release model, Arch strives to stay bleeding edge, and typically offers the latest stable versions of most software.

Read full topic
